bug.author: aabbi
bug.summary: Modified pos attribute not being serialized
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Since attribute of tokens is now writable (related <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/2014#issuecomment-376642763>comment</denchmark-link> ), I ran into the issue that I changed the pos tag and serialized the doc but on deserializing, it retained the original pos tag. I believe this is happening because only the attributes are pickled <denchmark-code>import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en') d = nlp("displaCy uses JavaScript, SVG and CSS to show you how computers understand language") print(d[0].pos_) # prints ADJ d[0].pos_ = "NOUN" d.to_disk("t.txt")
d2 = nlp("") d2.from_disk("t.txt") print(d2[0].pos_) # prints ADJ </denchmark-code>
Wasn't entirely sure if this should be a bug or a feature request to make pos tags picklable or maybe documentation could be added specifying how serializing would not save changes in coarse grained attributes with pos tag as examples <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.1.3 Platform: Ubuntu-14.04-trusty Python version: 3.6.8 Models: en_core_web_lg, en, en_core_web_md
